metadata.Title: CVE-2020-9951 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.Description:
A use after free issue was addressed with improved memory management. Thisissue is fixed in Safari 14.0. Processing maliciously crafted web contentmay lead to arbitrary code execution.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-9951` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-javascriptcoregtk-4.0 - 2.30.1-1
gir1.2-webkit2-4.0 - 2.30.1-1
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-18 - 2.30.1-1
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-bin - 2.30.1-1
libwebkit2gtk-4.0-37 - 2.30.1-1
webkit2gtk-driver - 2.30.1-1
No subscription required

libwpewebkit-1.0-3 - 2.30.0-1
wpewebkit-driver - 2.30.0-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: webkit2gtk package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.30.1-1').
qtwebkit-opensource-src package in jammy is affected and may need fixing.
wpewebkit package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.30.0-1').
